metadata.feature_description: Allows users to set custom column widths beyond predefined templates using percentage values.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Update layout with custom column sizes

steps.action: Navigate to page and enter Edit mode
steps.expected: Page shows edit controls and Content Layout modules are visible
steps.actual: Edit mode enabled, Content Layout modules with 4 columns displayed showing pane labels (F30A_Pane1-4)

steps.action: Locate Content Layout module with columns
steps.expected: Content Layout module with multiple columns visible
steps.actual: Two Content Layout modules visible with 4 columns each (TELEVISIONS, WEARABLES, TABLETS, LAPTOPS)

steps.action: Hover over resize handle between columns
steps.expected: Column size percentages should be displayed
steps.actual: All columns show 25% indicating equal-width default layout

steps.action: Drag resize handle to change first column width
steps.expected: Column should resize and adjacent column should adjust
steps.actual: First column expanded, second column shrunk - resize operation successful

steps.action: Verify new custom column sizes displayed
steps.expected: New percentage values should be shown

steps.action: Reload the page after setting custom column sizes
steps.expected: Custom column sizes should persist after page reload
steps.actual: Page reloaded successfully, still in edit mode

steps.action: Hover over resize handle to verify persisted sizes
steps.expected: Custom sizes should still be displayed
steps.actual: Column sizes retained: 33%, 17%, 25%, 25% (slight rounding variation from original)

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify CSS class generation for custom sizes

steps.action: Inspect DOM to verify CSS classes and inline styles
steps.expected: Bootstrap grid classes should be present, with inline width styles for custom sizes
steps.actual: Columns have Bootstrap classes (col-lg-3 col-md-3 col-sm-3 col-xs-12) plus inline styles (width: 33%, width: 17%, etc.) that override the class-based widths

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Test responsive behavior with custom sizes

steps.action: Resize browser to mobile viewport (480px width)
steps.expected: Columns should adjust for mobile view
steps.actual: Columns maintain custom percentage widths at mobile size. The inline styles with percentage widths override Bootstrap responsive classes (col-xs-12). This is expected behavior - custom sizes are applied via inline styles.

steps.action: Attempt to resize column below minimum width (drag handle far left)
steps.expected: Column should stop at minimum width (105px per code configuration)
steps.actual: Column resize stopped at minimum width constraint - first column reduced to 13%, second column expanded to 37% to compensate. jQuery UI resizable enforced the minWidth option.

steps.action: Review code validation logic for column sizes
steps.expected: Valid column sizes should follow format rules: comma-separated percentages, max 3 values, total <= 99%
steps.actual: Code review confirms IsValidColumnSizes() validates: non-empty values, max 3 comma-separated numbers, each value must be positive, total sum must be <= 99. The UI enforces this through the resize widget constraints.

observations: Custom column sizes are stored as comma-separated percentage values (e.g., '33,16,25' for first three columns, last column is calculated as remainder)
The resize functionality uses jQuery UI resizable widget with containment and min/max width constraints
CSS classes from Bootstrap grid are generated but inline percentage styles override them for custom layouts
At mobile viewport sizes, custom percentage widths persist rather than stacking columns, since inline styles have higher specificity than Bootstrap responsive classes
Attempting to discard changes triggered a versioning conflict error 'Another user has taken action on the page', indicating integration with page versioning system
The UpdateLayoutWithColumnSizes API endpoint validates column sizes server-side before persisting
